title: Mining the Census for Every Beat
description: This text provides an overview of the US Census Bureau's data collection and offers tips for reporters on how to navigate the census's treasure trove of information. The author highlights four key sources of data: the Decennial Census, the American Community Survey (ACS), Annual Population Estimates, and the Current Population Survey (CPS). The article also discusses how to use FactFinder, the Census's search tool, to find tables on hundreds of topics, including housing units, tenure by race, and migration patterns.
